result.execSummary:
The defendant Megan Marie Conrad was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution payable to Robert Haack Diamonds for $110.00 or civil judgment with tax intercept. Bail to be applied if applicable.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Megan Marie Conrad

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($200.00 signature bond) gj

Defendant Megan Marie Conrad in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Defendant Megan Marie Conrad in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

**COURT VACATED THE STAYED WARRANT FROM THE PREVIOUS DATE**

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve FIFTY-FOUR (54) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for FIFTY-FOUR (54) DAYS time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

OTHER/CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

* Restitution payable to ROBERT HAACK DIAMONDS for ONE HUNDRED AND TEN DOLLARS ($110.00) or civil judgment WITH tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.
* ALL FEES, COSTS, SURCHARGES AND RESTITUTION TO BE PAID BY 09-26-2017 OR CIVIL JUDGMENT WITH TAX INTERCEPT.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.
defendant from Fod du Lac Co Jail, signed and filed
(from) Defendant to the Court.  Filed, sdg.

Attorney Joel Alan Mogren in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense advised that matter was to be set for Sentencing.  Defense advised that Defendant is NOT in custody in Milwaukee but may be in custody in Waupaca County.  COURT ISSUED AND STAYED A BENCH WARRANT UNTIL THE NEXT DATE.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.

Defendant Megan Marie Conrad in court with attorney Mary Dorothy Scholle.  Defendant Megan Marie Conrad in custody.  Ian Franklin Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Order to Produce from Fond Du Lac County Jail, filed
Letter received from an in-custody defendant who is requesting warrant be resolved in anticipation of release.  Copy of letter forwarded to J. Kriner, DA's Office, for action.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Joel Alan Mogren appeared EARLIER in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.

Attorney Joel Alan Mogren in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defense advised that Defendant wrote the date as JULY instead of JUNE.  Defense advised that Defendant is picking up her prescription at this time in a different County.  COURT ISSUED AND STAYED A BENCH WARRANT UNTIL THE NEXT DATE.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Megan Marie Conrad in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Conference proceeded on the Record.  Defendant is on active probation in another County for a period of FOUR (4) YEARS.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Megan Marie Conrad in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 33.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 08:30 am.
WISPD.  Filed, sdg.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 200.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  $200.00 PR BOND ORDERED FORFEITED.

Defendant Megan Marie Conrad in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

State renewed their motion to revoke the DPA and requested a sentencing date.  Defense conceded that there is a factual basis for the State's motion to revoke.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Megan Marie Conrad in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin who appears as a Friend of the Court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense advised that Defendant will NOT be retaining private Counsel but instead has requested that a new Public Defender be appointed.  COURT CONTINUES TO TAKE THE STATE'S MOTION TO REVOKE UNDER ADVISEMENT.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Status.

  Status conference scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Megan Marie Conrad in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense advised the Court that Defendant has requested a different Counsel.  Defendant advised the Court that after speaking with her mother, the Defendant's significant other and her mother will be paying for a private Attorney. State moves to revoke the DPA.  Court takes that motion under advisement at this time.  Defendant's significant other requested a NINETY (90) DAY adjournment.  Court WILL NOT allow an adjournment for that long.  Defendant to report back within TWO (2) weeks with details regarding a new Attorney.  Court orders matter adjourned to B. 33 for Status.  Status conference scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Megan Marie Conrad in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Court holds brief colloquy with Defendant.  Parties jointly agree to adjourn matter for 45-60 days.  Court orders matter adjourned to Br. 33 for final Review.  Review hearing scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Monthly Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Megan Marie Conrad in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Court VACATES the STAYED Bench Warrant from the previous hearing.  Defense reports that Defendant has been compliant in co-operating with counselling.  Defendant has obtained employment.  Court adjourns matter for final Review hearing in Br. 33.  Review hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Dawn Marie Rablin in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until
  Review hearing scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Megan Marie Conrad in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant is engaged in treatment and has recently tested negative.  Defendant will be transitioning to Wausau for treatment.  Defendant has begun community service, however it was at a for-profit organization.  Defendant needs to pay restitution.  Review hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.
As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.

Defendant Megan Marie Conrad in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Review hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Court appearance scheduled in Room 310, Safety Building, on 5/11/15 @ 3:00pm
